message: I'm excited to offer you this exceptional product! I think it's worth a significant investment, and I'm willing to start with an offer of $1200000. What do you think?
I'm interested in the product, but $1200000 is a bit steep for me. I was thinking more along the lines of $900000. Can you meet me in the middle?
I understand you're looking to save some money, but I'm not willing to go as low as $900000. I can meet you halfway from my original offer, so I'll counter with $1100000. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but $1100000 is still a bit too high for me. I'm thinking more along the lines of $950000. Can you consider that?

I can see you're serious about getting a good deal, but I'm not willing to go as low as $950000. I'll meet you halfway from my previous offer, so I'll counter with $1025000. This is my best price, and I think it's a fair compromise.

I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $1025000 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to meet you at $1000000, which is the price I was willing to pay from the beginning. Can you consider that?

I've already offered you the product at $1025000, and you've come back to $1000000. I'm not willing to go any lower than that, so I'll make one more counteroffer: $1050000. This is my final offer. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider other options.
I've already offered you $1000000, and you've rejected it. I'm not willing to pay more than that. If you're not willing to sell the product to me at that price, I'll have to consider other options.
